alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 11 at 2:10AM PDT until September 11 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 2 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches
